Hello,
    I was browsing the API for CrawlURIDispositionListener, and I ca=
me
upon this little blurb:

 * Also note that the object implementing this =
interface
 * must under <b>no circumstances</b> maintain a reference
 * to =
the CrawlURI beyond the scope of the relevant method
 * body!

What will ha=
ppen if a class implementing this interface DOES
temporarily maintain a ref=
erence to the CrawlURIs received through the
interface?  Will it be OK if t=
he references to the CrawlURIs are
released and available for GC eventually=
?  (e.g., store the CrawlURIs
in a set for processing after crawl completio=
n, after which the set is
emptied, freeing up all references to the CrawlUR=
Is)
